Representative_Docs: ['Diane Rae Gunter Birth: 1939 Death: 2025 Diane Rae Gunter, 86, passed on November 2, 2025 at her home in Soquel surrounded by family. Born May 13, 1939, in Soquel, she graduated from Santa Cruz high school where she met her husband, Jesse Edwin Gunter. She is survived by her daughter, son, grandchildren, and great grandchildren and is pre-deceased by her husband. Diane taught swimming to children for many years at Polly’s Puddle and spent her career working in a sheltered workshop for disabled adults in Oregon. She was an avid tennis and softball player early in life, and she found her love for golf later. She spent much of her time in her garden, often ending the day with a pint of her favorite Guinness. She enjoyed traveling and spending time with family and friends. Diane lived her life on her terms and will be missed by all. A celebration of life will be held January 17, 2026, at DeLaveaga Golf Course from 3 to 6 pm. Honor with Flowers In memory of Diane Rae Plant a Living Memorial In memory of Diane Rae', 'Janet Marie Flores Birth: 1931 Death: 2025 Janet Marie Flores passed away peacefully on November 21, 2025 at the age of 94 surrounded by the love of her family. Jan was born on October 31, 1931 in San Francisco to loving parents Alice Detour and Joseph Hettrick. Jan was a loving mother, grandmother and great grandmother who found her greatest joy in her family. She had a way of making people feel welcomed. She was kind, big hearted, extremely gracious and devoted to those she loved. Her presence will be deeply missed. Jan lived a long life traveling, playing golf, bunco with her friends and one of her greatest talents was to find a treasure at garage sales. In her final years she enjoyed playing penny slots at the casino. The last nine years Jan spent in the loving care of her daughter and son in law. A special thank you to her granddaughter Samantha for making her last days warm, comfortable and full of love. Jan survived by her daughter Tina Schilling (Michael), her grandchildren Michael (Marissa), Paul (Kacie), Samantha (Carlos), and her nine great grandchildren Jackson, Aubrey, Jordan, Mikey, Ellie, Luna, Ryder, Makayla and Stella. And her friends who will forever cherish her memory. Representative_Docs: ['6 killed in Mississippi mass shooting, suspect charged with murder Authorities have charged a 24-year-old man with murder after six people — including a child — were killed in a series of shootings in northeast Mississippi. Clay County Sheriff Eddie Scott said the victims — four family members related to the suspect and two other adults — were shot at three separate locations late Friday. The youngest victim was a cousin of the suspect. Representative_Docs: ['Senate looks at barring sale of lands BOISE — The Senate State Affairs Committee voted to introduce a proposed amendment to the Idaho State Constitution that would bar the state from selling future public land acquisitions from the federal government. Sen. Ben Adams, R-Nampa, presented his proposal Wednesday following a public outreach campaign to gauge Idahoans’ concerns on the issue of public lands and receive feedback on the language within his amendment. Fewer than 500 people call this Grant County town home, but lately the town is busy rallying around a group of high school students. In the basement of Peace Grue Lutheran in the middle of town, five high school students join veteran church quilters in tying quilts that the students will take on their trip to South Africa. "There is a reason the church ladies do this and not the guys," joked Kevin Fick, the girls\' weightlifting coach and organizer of the trip, of tying quilts the students will take with them as gifts. Five girls, along with Fick and four adult chaperones, will make the trip to Eastern Cape, South Africa, from Feb. 28 through March 10. Not as tourists, but to learn about conservation on another continent. "Not a lot of kids get to do this," said student Hadley Hokanson, student.
